alert.note: Alert for DeKalb (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 5:59PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern DeKalb County through 645 PM CDT... At 559 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Crossville, or 10 miles east of Boaz, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Crossville, Geraldine, Lakeview, Lebanon, Dog Town, Arona, Kilpatrick, Rodentown, Chigger Hill and Skirum. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
